newsitem.title: PERU: List of 20 hostages freed by Peru rebels.
newsitem.headline: List of 20 hostages freed by Peru rebels.

text.p: The 20 hostages freed on Saturday by Marxist rebels were two foreign ambassadors, nine Japanese and one South Korean businessmen, seven Peruvian diplomats and one local businessman.

Following the release, the Tupac Amaru Revolutionary Movement (MRTA) rebels held 83 captives in the Japanese ambassador's residence, including top Peruvian officials, the Japanese, Bolivian and Honduran ambassadors and Japanese VIPs.
The following is a list of the hostages released on Saturday:
-Jose Diaz - Dominican Republic ambassador to Peru.
-Ahmad Mokhtar - Malaysian ambassador to Peru.
-Makoto Sasa - Japanese executive of Matsushita Denki Sangyo.
-Kentaro Kataoka - Japanese executive of Mitsui Bussan.
-Shuji Saito - Japanese executive of Kinzoku.
-Yamamoto Tameyuki - Japanese executive of Nissho Iwai.
-Kazuhiko Noguchi - Japanese executive of Marubeni.
-Tadashi Ishii - Japanese executive of Ajinomoto.
-Takashi Nambu - Japanese executive of Kanematsu.
-Yasunori Kashiwagi - Japanese executive of Toyota Motor.
-Yoshinobu Hashimoto - Japanese executive of Santa Luis.
-Lee Mion Ho - South Korean executive of Mitsubishi.
-Edwin Clarke - Peruvian Foreign Ministry official.
-Juan Carlos Capunay - Peruvian Foreign Ministry official.
-Cord Dammert - Peruvian Foreign Ministry official.
-Julio Cardenas - Peruvian Foreign Ministry official.
-Gustavo Laurie - Peruvian Foreign Ministry official.
-Cesar Vallejo - Peruvian Foreign Ministry official.
-Pedro Buitron - Peruvian Foreign Ministry official.
-Enrique Pendavis - President of the Peruvian Asociation of Exporters.
